The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
The first programmable computer was invented by Charles Babbage in 1833.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to thermal expansion of the metal.
The first man to urinate on the moon was Buzz Aldrin, shortly after stepping onto the lunar surface.
Leonardo da Vinci could write with one hand and draw with the other at the same time.
Napoleon Bonaparte was once attacked by a horde of rabbits.
The shortest, oldest, and tallest trees in the world can all be found in California.
The first known contraceptive was crocodile dung, used by Egyptians in 2000 B.C.
The Guinness World Record for the longest hiccuping spree is held by Charles Osborne, who hiccuped continuously for 68 years.
